subject: Re: [junit] Running tests multiple times w/ different config
msgSnippet: Hi, Try using the Parameterized Test pattern - you should be able to find details of it online. Cheers, Steve. ... Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
messageBody:
Hi,

Try using the Parameterized Test pattern - you should be able to find
details of it online.

Cheers,

Steve.

---
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

Gilles Scokart wrote:
>
>
> You could write an abstract test with one subclass per database. The
> parent class containing the real test, the subclass containing only
> the setup.
>
> Or you can maybe try to do someting using test suite.
>
> Gilles
>
> 04 Mar 2007 23:36:58 -0800, cwhite102 <craig.whitex@...
> <mailto:craig.whitex%40rogers.com>>:
> > I was wondering if anyone has a good suggestion to accomplish this
> > goal.
> >
> > I'd like to have some of my automated integration tests to run
> > multiple times, against various databases. This way I can make sure
> > different databases (oracle, mssql, etc) don't exhibit different
> > behaviour.
> >
> > Effectively, I'd like my unit tests to run multiple times with a
> > little hook in between for me to setup my hibernate configuration (to
> > point it at each database).
> >
> > I'd prefer not to tweak anything in Ant because I'm using Netbeans
> > generated ant scripts and, well quite frankly, changing them scares me.
> >
> > I don't mind having a little code in my tests if needed, like setting
> > up a special suite or something.
> >
> > Any suggestions?
> >
